sect2.title: Supported Platforms
sect2.para: The Supported Platforms Matrix currently list all the systems that Iometer currently runs on. This is updated as new systems are added.

sect2.title: Installing the Iometer Software
sect2.para: As of this writing, the latest stable Iometer version is 2003-12-16.
The Iometer files are available at www.iometer.org. If a precompiled binary is available for your system, we recommend its use.

sect3.title: Installing the Windows Binaries
sect3.para: The file for the Windows 32-bit binary is iometer-2003.12.16.win32-bin.zip.
The file for the Windows 64-bit binary is iometer-2003.12.16.win64.ia64-bin.zip.

listitem.para: Download the binary file by clicking on the appropriate link above. When asked, select a directory to save the file into.
Double-click the file in the directory where you saved the file. (WinZip or another decompression program is required.)
Extract the files into a directory of your choice. (eg. 'C:\IOMETER')
On your desktop, right-click on the screen and select 'New' then 'Create New Shortcut'.
Find the directory where you decompressed the zip file. Double-Click on 'iometer-2003.12.16'.

sect3.para: You now have the Iometer program installed on your computer. To run Iometer, just double-click the icon that was created on your desktop.

sect3.title: Installing the Linux Binaries
sect3.para: The file for the Linux 32-bit binary is iometer-2003.12.16.linux-bin.tar.gz.
Decomress the files using the tar command.
This will install the binary into iometer-2003.12.16/src directory.

sect2.title: Known Issues / Bugs
sect2.para: As new issues and bugs are found in Iometer, they are listed in the Know Issues Listing.
